values:
You know, I was going to post this extremely loooooooong entry about how everything is turning out quite perfectly for me nowadays, how it seems like I was wandering through a dark spooky forest previously and have now stumbled upon a beautiful clearing with a waterfall and birds chirping and sun shining and blah blah blah... yeah, sentimental crap like that. In fact, I've been trying to write that entry for about 3 months now, and especially during these last 2 weeks cuz ALL KINDS of sweetness has been happening to me lately, but... well, let's just say that I'm tired of waking up with keyboard prints all over one side of my face. So now, you're just basically gonna hafta take my word for it. Here's a really, really brief rundown for you. 1. Leaving November 1st (possibly earlier, but most definitely no later) for Airborne Cryptological Linguist job in Air Force. Sometime soon, I'll give you a complete list of why it's by far the most awesome position I could have possibly chosen. I think the phrase "Bling Bling!" sums it all up quite well. 2. Got a raise, slight promotion, and a few benefits from the part-time job I currently have at Lowe's. What, you didn't know I work at Lowe's? I've been working there for the past 4 months, where have you been?!?! 3. Cielo is the most greatest thing to ever happen to me. Ever. It will literally take me hours to explain all of why, so I'm not even gonna try. I'll just leave it at "she's perfect for me in all ways." Oh, and here's a picture:
Are we the perfect couple or what?
 4. My other friends are awesome too. Nuff said. 5. My family can be kinda cool. We're taking a 7-day Caribbean cruise in early September, and well, "psyched" isn't quite sufficient for describing my current state of being in regards to this. "Bouncing off the walls" is closer, but still not completely there. "Jubilant"? Almost... So yeah, life is good. One day, when I have the entire day to myself, I'll be able to more fully explain myself, but don't hold your breath. However, I AM open to answering individual questions, so feel free to shoot away. Or not. Whatever.

Well, tomorrow, Cielo is coming to my house to have dinner with mi familia. Needless to say, we're both kinda nervous cuz we really don't know what to expect. After all, this is the first girlfriend I'll have ever actually introduced to my folks, which in itself would probably be manageable, but then there's the whole language thing (as usual). I guess I'm gonna hafta spend all day translating for dear Cielo, but my Spanish is still utterly craptastic, so I don't believe that's gonna work so well. And then there's the fact that Cielo's already seen the inside of my house before (my parents went out of town for their anniversary on June 6th, so we took advantage of the empty house and had an anniversary our own, hehe), so now she's gonna hafta act like she's never seen it before. And she better do it well, too.

So all in all, we've really got our work cut out for us, so wish us luck / pray for us / do whatever crazy stuff you think will influence this dinner for the better. Life would be so much easier if my folks ended up really liking my girl. Oh dear god yes!

Well, that's all for now, other news later (when I'm not falling asleep as I type).

So apparently, I only write in this journal if 1) life is going EXTREMELY well, 2) life is sucking hardcore, or 3) life is sucking hardcore, but I'm trying to make it seem like it's going well. This is definitely about option #1. First off, let's get the whole "I love Cielo" bit out of the way real quick, so I can get it out of my system and get to more of the good stuff. Well, yesterday was our 2-month anniversary. Yep, 2 whole months of dating perfection. Now usually, I hate keeping track of "month anniversaries" because I am extremely well-acquainted with the fact that they mean absolutely nothing. I mean, Superman could probably date Kryptonite Girl for a whole month without any major problems, and a dead clock has the right time at least twice a day, so the number of months a couple has been together is entirely insignificant. However, Cielo is such a sweetheart that she calls me on every month-anniversary to tell me how much she loves me, and then she buys me a gift. In fact, she gets me a gift like every other week, just to say "yo te amo." God, I love that girl. She has been the best thing that has ever happened to me in El Paso. Scratch that - she's the best thing to ever happen to me, period. It will be impossible to find another girl who is as in tune with me at all times, the way she is. The only problem I'm seeing is that perhaps we're moving a bit too fast: We already have names picked out for our first boy and girl (I'd write them here, but don't wanna ruin the surprise, hehe). Also, I'm apparently scheduled to meet her entire family after I return from my East Coast trip, and that scares the utter crap outta me. Fortunately, her siblings all speak some English, and I seem to have already outranked and outdone her ex-boyfriend by miles, so all should go well. As for her meeting MY folks... well, that's an entirely different story. My mom has been bugging me for the last month about meeting her, but argh... if you knew my mom, you'd know why I'm a slight bit worried. But it'll hafta happen eventually, so we'll see... You probably saw that "East Coast trip" part and are thinking, "wait, what East Coast trip?" Well folks, I've finally booked myself that long-awaited ticket, so this Friday (i.e. tomorrow), I will be on my way to NYC, baby!!! I'll FINALLY be able to see my boy Steve in his natural habitat, and also meet up with some family members that I haven't seen in like 7 or 8 years. HELL'S YEAH!!! You can probably tell that I'm way fucking excited about this; that's cuz I NEVER get to do shit like this usually. NEVER. In fact, this will be the first time in my life that I'll be farther north than North Carolina on the East Coast. Not only that, but I'm finally gonna see the Big Apple AND the nation's capital, AND possibly the City of Brotherly Love. ALL IN ONE TRIP. [Please wait while Darnell does the Happy Dance of Joy.] OK, back. Now, a brief update on the whole Air Force deal: still...fucking...waiting. I pretty much have the whole linguist thing in the bag now, after like 3 months of believing there was absolutely no hope, but getting that job seems to have added on another 6 months to my waiting time. And it's fucking KILLING me; I want to get out of El Paso so bad now, I can practically taste it. Sure, I'll be away from my Luz de mi Vida (my pet name for Cielo, she loves it), but it's all good cuz as soon as I get to Cali, she's planning on flying there after me ASAP. This also falls under the "moving too fast" category, but I'm actually happier about it than I am annoyed. This way, I'm taking the most important piece of my home area away with me to a better place, a better job, and a better life. I really couldn't ask for more.

Well it's almost 3am, my family just went to bed, and I'm still awake, so I figured now would be a good time to update you all about this crazy thing called Darnell's Life. Oh, it's a strange and magnificent thing, constantly changing and shifting in entirely unexpected ways. Right when I think I've got it all figured out and can start plotting its next move, BAM, something occurs that knocks it way the fuck off course. Let's take my whole Air Force situation as an example. I've been dealing with these damn military bastards since February of 2005; I've gone through four (that's right, FOUR) different recruiters; and I've actually signed contracts for two different Air Force jobs thus far, with a 3rd one on its way; yet, I still don't have a fucking clue how it's all going to end up. Remember how I was going after that one linguist position? (Perks include: $10,000 bonus, I get to spend a year in sunny California learning a new language, can further my education at any university I want FOR FREE, and more...) Well, more than a month ago, my recruiter's boss called me up and told me that my exception-to-policy had been denied... 3 weeks prior to him calling me. Needless to say, I was more than a little pissed-off, disappointed, and upset, but since I was once again told that there was nothing I could do about it, I kinda forced myself to get over it and become content with the job I already had signed up for: Air Traffic Controller. The thing is, my departure date for that job was scheduled to be May 30th. Yes, that would be 10 days from now. So for the entire month of April, I told everybody that I was joining the Air Force and leaving on May 30th. Then May rolls around, and I suddenly decide that I really DON'T want to do ATC, I still want something different, preferably computer-related (for obvious reasons). So, I call the Air Force job-placement people up and... well, let's make a long story short: I basically find out that there's a loophole that would get me into the linguist job after all. So now, we're back on the whole linguist deal AGAIN. Gone is the May 30th deadline; now, it's back to the endless waiting that will probably take months and months because the gov't hates me and likes wrapping me up in red tape. I'm seriously considering just saying "fuck it" and going with the ATC thing, despite the fact that their tech school is in Mississippi. If there's one place I'd rather not go, it'd be the redneck-breeding ground known as the Deep South, but I think all this waiting is gonna get to me sooner than any drunken ignorant redneck can, so yeah. So there's that, and then there's Life Derailer #2: Cielo (I'll try not to stray into gushing and all that sappy shit, I promise). Let's just say this girl really has it in for me, hardcore. We were talking about our experiences before we met, and she told me that she had had plenty of chances to start other relationships after she broke up with her ex, but she never felt safe enough to put her trust into any of these guys, until she met me. In fact, she hadn't kissed any, hugged any, exchanged numbers, NOTHING, until she did all of the above with me that first night. Even that very night, she had turned down all other offers to dance before I walked in (and we know what happened after that). So, this wasn't some crazy drunk party-loving chick I happened to hook up with; this was someone who had decided not to trust guys ever again, but then changed her mind upon first sight of ME. I asked her "why me?" and she said she could just sense it, kinda like it was destined that way or something. Kinda eerie, if you ask me. So now, we've gotten to the point where she's planning to move out to California with me (she has relatives in Los Angeles). Let me make sure you all understand: she's willing to leave her family and all her friends, to discontinue her current education at her university, to live in a land where people speak a language she's not familiar with, all for the sake of being with ME. I'm not quite certain how I feel about this: on one hand, I truly love this girl, and I know that she'd be an excellent mother and wife; on the other hand, this completely screws up my plan to be the world's greatest manwhore. Never heard of a married manwhore before, have you? Yeah, me neither. OK, I'm dozing off as I type this, so I guess I'd better finish it tomorrow. More

I swear, if someone made a movie of my entire life, it would become the world's greatest drama overnight. "Titanic" would be considered a lame comedy in comparison. It's like God Himself pulls a few strings here and there, just to make sure things don't turn out anything like the way I want them. Yet, through it all, I can still see some light at the end of this long, dark, menacing tunnel. Ironically, some of that light is coming from my Luz del Cielo (Light of the Sky, if you don't remember), with whom I spent the most amazing night with this past Saturday. And I'm not just talking physically, even though there's absolutely nothing to complain about in THAT area; no, I mean mentally and spiritually and... actually, I don't really know WHAT I mean. All I can say is that the girl is DEEP, on a level that I've never quite encountered with anyone else before. An example: the way her last (and only other) relationship ended was by her walking in on her boyfriend and some other chick while they were making out in bed, both butt-naked. She yelled at the dumbass piece-of-shit and hit him, and then he, the greatest scum of the earth, hit her back. I wouldn't even be able to lay a finger on the most wretched bitch in the universe, yet this asshole is able to hit his girlfriend of 5 years, after she catches him in bed with another girl. Unbelievable. Cielo told me that she didn't want to continue living after all that, and I could totally see that she wasn't exaggerating or dramatizing in any kinda way. Imagine what something like that would do to someone's entire psychological being; hell, it took ME 3 months to recover from breaking up with Priya, and I didn't even catch her in bed with anybody (not saying that she didn't do anything like that, just saying that i didn't CATCH her). Yet somehow, Cielo's made it through 6 months since that disaster, and now she has... me.

I can't believe how badly I'm falling for this girl. I try to write a short LJ entry about all the crazy shit that's going on in my life, and I end up writing paragraphs about HER, and only her. I hear a song on the radio, and I think about her. I see a commercial on TV, and it reminds me of her. I hear her voice over the phone, and... ah, I could go on and on (looks like I already have), but this is very very bad. She's already making future plans for the two of us, and contrary to everything my brain is screaming at me ("SHE DOESN'T SPEAK ENGLISH, MORON!" "YOU'RE TOO YOUNG FOR THIS KINDA SHIT!" "WHAT IS YOUR ENTIRE FAMILY GONNA THINK ABOUT ALL THIS?"), I find myself thinking that maybe a future with her wouldn't be so bad. She truly has all the qualities I have ever desired in a woman: patience, intelligence, maturity, passion for life, and extreme beauty, to name just a few. Dammit, what the hell is happening here? I'm so utterly lost...

This entry wasn't even supposed to be about her.

Well, for the last month or 2 (or 3, who's counting?), I've been ignoring LJ to the point where I wasn't reading anyone's LJs. In one sense, that's a good thing, for a reason I'm not about to share, but on the other hand, it seems like I've been missing out on a bit. I think I'll allow myself to wade back into the world of LJ, if only for a little while.

Hi, yes, haven't updated in a long time, blah blah blah. You should realize by now that there isn't gonna be many entries in here from now on. Maybe one or two utterly life-changing/mind-altering/havoc-wreaking events, but that's only if the mood catches me. So anyway, the latest mind-altering event in my life: my family and I went vacationing in Phoenix last week. My sister's missionary organization was having a conference there, so the rest of us decided that we'd go along too. And lemme tell ya, the conference was pretty fucking sweet, even for those of us who aren't exactly "enamored with love for our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ". You didn't have to be Christian, or even religious, to get something important out of it all. So what exactly did I get out of it? ...Well, that's something that would take me 2 days to explain, so I'm just gonna skip it. Let's just say that it all kinda blew my mind, and it's singlehandedly gonna cause me to do astounding achievements in the future. Yes, it was that powerful. We also got to watch the Phoenix Suns play against the Sacramento Kings at the US Airways Center. Holy shit, it was good! I used to think that professional sports were dull and passionless compared to college sports, but this game defnitly proved me wrong. No wonder ppl pay so much for those tickets. On the way back from Phoenix, we stopped at the house where I grew up when my mom and I lived in Tucson, and took a bunch of pictures. I hadn't been in Tucson since I was about 7, so it was defnitly cool to check out a far-distant portion of my childhood. It makes me wonder how my life woulda turned out if we had just stayed there, instead of ending down here in the middle of nowhere. It's no secret that I think Arizona is about ten gazillion times prettier and more exciting than EP can ever hope to be, and plus the girls there are SCORCHING hot. I seriously did not see a single fat girl, the entire time we were there. But it's not like I can change the past, so I'm just gonna have to hope I end up there sometime in the future. Speaking of hot girls and changing the past, it's reached my attention recently that tomorrow (er, today) is Valentine's Day. For the 2nd year in a row, I'm completely, totally, 100% single, but somehow I really truly don't care this year. Part of it is cuz I view V-Day as a totally bullshit holiday, kinda like Sweetest Day, purposely concocted to employ guilt as a means to extort money from your average American consumer. I mean, come on people; if you truly love someone, then you shouldn't have to wait for a certain day each year to show it. You should be able to buy your sweetie flowers and chocolate on any day of the year, not just on the day when Hallmark tells you you're supposed to. But anyway, the other part of it is that I've decided not to date anyone for the next few years or so. I've kinda realized that committing myself to just one single female is truly a bad move on my part. A few reasons why: it detracts my attention from other important aspects of my life, as well as from my other friends; it ties me down somewhat and keeps me from doing some of the stuff i truly enjoy doing; it prevents me from "experimenting" the way I plan to as soon as I leave EP; and last but not least, it's just biologically unreasonable. Here, lemme say it a different way: in my experience and observations, getting into a relationship causes you nothing but trouble, unless you're absolutely positively certain that the person you're getting involved with is someone you want to spend the rest of your life with. And even then, you still gotta be careful. But I, for one, have very little hope of finding that Special One out there anytime soon (cuz it'll defnitly take someone extra special to deal with ME for a lifetime), so in the meantime, I plan on having as much fun as possible. And yes, that will entail copious amounts of random hook-ups and one-night-stands, so yeah... um, what was I talking about? Oh yeah, Valentine's Day is really easily-brainwashed suckers, and I sincerely hope that my future wifey or whoever won't get all pissy and shit when I get her absolutely nothing for V-Day. On a random side note, Sean Paul's "The Trinity" album is all that, plus a big bag of chips and some dip. It's up on my list with Black Eyed Peas' "Elephunk" and Eminem's "Marshall Mathers LP". There is seriously not a single song on the entire album that I dislike. I guess the whole Caribbean dancehall rhythm it's got goin on really jives well with my soul. I haven't stopped listening to it ever since I dl-ed it 2 weeks ago. OK, that be all, folks. I'm out

So yesterday, I tried to write this humLONGous entry about Steve's awesome visit to El Paso, and about why I haven't been updating IN this lj at all, but then I got bored and unmotivated, and quit. Which is basically why I haven't been updating IN this thing, at all. So deal wit it. But I will at least leave you with few pics: I don't think we'd make very good priests; let's just say that the water wouldn't be very holy once we're done with it... This is Steve gettin jiggy with it in Juarez. Wish we coulda stayed longer. Where's the best place to go big pimpin? Texas, of course! Have you ever seen two studlier guys? I think not. I have more, but I'm too lazy to upload them. I think that last pic is by far one of the best pics ever taken of me, if I do say so myself. So yeah, good times with the International Man of Mystery in my hometown; I was pretty worn out by the time he left, but it was well worth it. I was looking at aforementioned amazing picture (it's taped to the top of my dresser mirror, where it belongs), and started thinking about how very different all of my friends are. Just look at ethnicity alone: I'm good friends with a half-Chinese-half-Polish dude, a Peruvian-Austrian, a Mexican-American (duh, I live on the freakin border), 2 Russians, a Sri Lankan, and 3 Indians. And I dated an Indian and an Irish-Italian. Hmmm, what's up with all the Indians? It's probably the Indian 4th of myself attracting them. Then why the hell isn't the 3/4ths Caribbean part of me trying to attract some fellow Caribbeans? Eh, whatever. Anyway, the point is that America is actually doing a pretty good job being the melting pot that it tries to portray itself as, despite its racist past and its outsider-intolerant present. I'm glad that my children will be able to see MLK's dream fully come true. But, I still don't feel as though I've met enough people from different cultures to have a good understanding of the world beyond America's borders. Steve and I had dinner with one of my mother's Nigerian clients, and they were all mad impressed by Steve's extensive knowledge of other countries. Meanwhile, I couldn't say shit because I haven't been further than 3 miles from either American border. This, my friends, is pathetic; I live practically ON the fucking border, so how have I not gone anywhere past it in my entire life? This is something I'm gonna hafta correct in the next few years, PRONTO. And it would start with me getting that goddamn linguist position and getting the fuck out of El Paso. Steve's visit only helped me to realize even more how utterly stifled I am in this place; no fewer than 3 different people told me that while he was here. OK, I think I'm gonna skip the "El Paso is a fucking cage" rant I feel coming on, I'm sure you're all tired of it now. Anyway, it's rare to find a friend that can wake up your life, excite your mind, and dazzle your entire family during a brief 4-day visit. Steve, I'm glad you came; now it's my turn, bro. My turn.

Wow, it's been a ridiculously long time since I last updated this thing. Then again, I barely even look at it anymore, so I guess it's not TOO surprising. Anyway, I have a lot to write, but it's VERRRRRYYYY late and I need to get to bed, so here's a brief synopsis:

1) I got rear-ended on Friday night. My truck is now literally crumpled up on the driver's side, from the bumper to the back tires. This makes me very sad :(. But, the people who hit me were very nice, so they're gonna make sure their insurance pays for the damages. More details later.

2) Steve has booked a ticket to come here and visit me for MLK Weekend (January 13-16). This, of course, makes me very happy. Finally, the Dynamic Duo will be able to wreak havoc upon El Paso, the likes of which have never been seen before! I can't find the right words to express how very psyched I am about this.

3) I'm this much closer to getting my linguist job from the Air Force. The "higher-ups" contacted my recruiter 2 weeks ago and asked for paperwork proving that I've been making my payments (which I've definitely been doing). Problem: none of my creditors will provide such paperwork, it's "against company policy" or some such bullshit. Solution: I told my recruiter to tell the higher-ups to just call the assholes. Problem: I accidently overdrew my bank account by 3 dollars on Monday, causing one of my creditors' payment checks to be returned, unpaid. Solution: I'm going to overnight a money order to them tomorrow morning, so that it'll hopefully reach them before any Air Force people decide to call. Keep your fingers crossed.

4) Jeremy and Satish left the best drunken voicemail I've ever heard in my entire life on Saturday nite/Sunday morning. I just finished chatting with Jeremy on AIM, which is why I'm writing this entry so late. Man, I miss Drunken Pool Thursdays and Necto Saturdays like nothing else. I desperately need to make one more trip to Michigan before I proceed with the rest of my life.

OK, that's it for now, more details on all of this stuff later. Ciao

Well, well, well, if it isn't ye olde LJ!!! Long time no see, buddy, how's it hanging? Probably wondering what I've been up to since the last time I wrote in here, huh? Alright then, here goes: Air Force shit If I had a normal life, I would currently be holding a complete Air Force contract, stating what my job and position is, how much I'm gonna get paid, and when my exact date of departure is. Unfortunately, normality doesn't seem to exist my internal dictionary, and thus I'm currently engaged in a lengthy waiting game that probably could've been avoided. There's a long, long story behind that which I don't really feel like telling right now, but here's a brief synopsis for ya: I got completely fucked over by the Air Force job counselor, was given a job that I absolutely didn't want, raised a huge fuss about it, and was told that the job couldn't be changed. This was quite unacceptable, so I was forced to unleash the unbridled fury of my parental units, which invariably produces results (not always good ones, but something is better than nothing). We had an intense tongue-lashing session nice little chat with my recruiter and his boss, and now I'm waiting for an exception-to-policy (ETP) that will allow me to take the linguist job I wanted all along. I need an ETP because linguists require top secret security clearance, and the Air Force doesn't usually grant those to people with financial problems. They figure I'd be more susceptible to being bought off by some Russian commie or something. The boss wouldn't have even bothered trying to get one, except I made one of the highest scores they've ever seen on their Language Aptitude test. Not sure how I did that, but whatever. The whole ETP process supposedly takes 30-45 days, so now I get to twiddle my thumbs and drool until I find out if I get it or not. It better fucking go through, cuz it would suck balls to go through all this and end up with nothing. Thanksgiving We ate and got fat. That's what the holiday is for, right? I also chatted with Feinstein for the first time since I left Michigan. There are very few people on earth that I can talk to and be completely, totally, 100% understood, and whom I can understand 100% likewise. There are many who make it to 75%, 80%, even 90%, but as for 100%, there are only 3: Steve, my sister,... and Feinstein. It's odd, cuz both Feinstein and I have a little sister each, are children of 1st generation US immigrants, are conservative but not Republican, were raised with similar morals and religious beliefs, are incommunicado with our exes,... the list goes on. It's like having a twin brother that was raised by a different family. Anyway, we were pretty happy to hear from eachother, and are definitely planning to visit eachother regularly in the future. Church We finally finished the whole Leadership School deal, which was surprisingly quite enjoyable and enlightening for me. It taught me stuff that I can actually use later in life, rather than the "bow down to your savior Jesus Christ or burn in eternal hell forever" stuff that I was expecting. But now, I have a 4-hour gap on Sundays that I'm unaccustomed to, so I decided to join the church's Christmas choir. "But Darnell, you couldn't hold a note if someone came and superglued it to your hand!" First, yes I can, so shut the fuck up. Second, even if I couldn't, it'd be a good chance to improve upon what little vocal skillz I currently have. Anything that causes self-improvement is welcome to me, no matter what area the improvement is in. Besides, it's a good chance to meet hot babes new people. Other shit Speaking of meeting "new people", I gave out my phone number to some cute Applebee's waitress with a nice ass earlier this week. She wasn't really all that interesting; I only did it cuz my boy Steve told me to on the phone while I was eating my food. Only a friend like Steve can give you good last-minute advice from a thousand miles away. Anyway, I don't actually expect her to ever call me or anything, but it was still a pivotal event for me cuz it was the first time I've ever done that outside of a club or bar. It tells me that I'm not a chickenshit coward anymore when it comes to the ladies; the only reason I had any girlfriends before is because they actively pursued me, rather than the other way around. Especially Priya; that girl dumped some dude and pulled every trick in the book for 2 months straight to hook up with me (hence my sincere surprise when she dumped me a year later; I guess what goes around comes around). So now, I won't be content with the first girl that smiles or winks at me, which is good cuz I'm gonna hafta protect my future Air Force money from all the little golddiggers out there. Yup yup, I thoroughly plan to go out and be the biggest pimp in the universe once I get out of EP, cuz being locked up in this house with my folks has truly driven me insane, and I've got a lot of lost time to make up for. Alright that's all for now. I'm out

So, I guess some pretty exciting shit has been happening to me recently. First, I got my braces taken off on Monday. HELL'S YEAH, BABY, THEY'RE FINALLY GONE!!!! Jesus freakin Christ, they were on for such a fucking long time, I can barely believe they're not there anymore. Yet, when I look in the mirror now, all I can see are my shiny pearly whites gleaming back at me, completely metal-free. Goddamn, it feels so good; I can finally turn on the full Darnizzle charm without having to worry about having a huge piece of cheeseburger or something hanging from my teeth. *Pauses to lick entire row of teeth* Yup, they're definitely gone. Sweet. :-) And in slightly related news, I just got final approval to join the Air Force today. Yes folks, you read that correctly: Darnell is soon to be an official United States Air Force Airman! People, this is the "big news" that I've been hinting about for the past few months; this is the reason I came back to EP and did literally nothing to secure a real full-time job for myself. I actually started this process way back in freakin February, after realizing that I hated being poor and consistently broke; unfortunately, the fact that I've always been poor and broke (and thus in massive debt) kinda got in the way. Apparently, the Air Force doesn't like accepting fools who don't know how to manage their own finances. So I left Michigan, returned to the safe haven of good ol' El Pisso, and proceeded to bust my ass contacting all of my debtors, setting up payment arrangements, disputing incorrect items on my credit reports, the whole nine yards. Now, I only have 3 debts left on my credit (U of M, U-M Hospital, and U-M Credit Union... notice a pattern?), and payments are being consistently paid to all of them. After that, the only thing blocking me from getting in was my mouthful of metal, and well, hehe... mission accomplished. We ended up having to go to Juarez (that's the part of El Paso that isn't in the U.S., in case you didn't know) to get the braces off cuz in EP, such an operation costs $450. In Mexico, it cost us $80. God, I love Mexicans and their ridiculously low prices. So tomorrow, they're sticking me in a hotel for some briefing, and then on Thursday, I take my physical exam (pushups, situps, etc) and go on to choose my official Air Force job. Despite my computer skillz and whatnot, I'm actually hoping for a linguistics position, cuz then I get a $10,000 signing bonus. Oddly enough, you don't even have to know any foreign languages beforehand, you just have to prove your ability to learn new languages. I figure, "Why not? I've been wanting to learn Japanese or Chinese anyway." But regardless of all that... free food, free housing, free health benefits, free dental that I don't need anymore, free college loan repayments that I desperately need, here I come!!! I always did say, "If it's for free, it's for me!", so this just fits in perfectly! You're probably thinking, "Why the fuck were you so insistent on keeping that from us? It wasn't really all THAT important or huge, nothing to get all stupid about. You're such a dumbass, Darnell." We were passing UTEP (University of Texas at El Paso) today, like we do every day, and I noticed that they had already started classes there. I started to get all excited and pumped up, like "yeah, school's starting again, woohoo!!!!" Then I remembered that I'm done with all that, and I became completely bummed out. I think it just kinda hit me that I'm going to miss college a whole lot more than I expected. College football has been brought up a lot during chats with random folk, and I'm always going on about "Wolverine football this" and "Michigan football that", but I doubt I'll ever be able to go back to the Big House and watch a Michigan game anytime in the next decade or so. This mades me vewy vewy sad. I'm gonna miss the Friday night beer pong parties, and then waking up with a slight hangover Saturday morning to the sounds of people trying to find parking on our front lawn and the annoying dude next door yelling stupid shit at all of them through his bullhorn. I'm gonna miss being able to get together with 5-10 friends and going crazy as our Maize 'n' Blue give hell to some random Big Ten team. I'm gonna miss the Saturday night victory parties, with an air of comraderie and drunkenness all over the place, and then waking up with a slightly larger hangover Sunday morning and realizing that I have 10000 tons of homework to get done in 24-or-less hours. OK, maybe I won't miss that last part, but that's not the point. Point is, that's actually just a small portion of what I'm going to be missing about college life. I only take comfort in the fact that I now know where I'm going in life and have at least 2 definite careers lined up for myself in the near future. Looks like I'm gonna hafta wait a little longer to see if my preferred one is gonna pan out, but my expectations are rather high. You'll all get the news next month. Either way, I will eventually be making decent money, and then I will be able to afford to 1) move somewhere else, 2) take full control of my own life, and 3) start truly enjoying it. The only question I'll have then is HOW to enjoy my life, but I'm sure I'll be able to figure something out. I can be somewhat creative when I need to be. My sister and I were chatting about our earlier childhood together today, and we started laughing about how very opposite we always were. She was a hyper, energetic drama queen with a vivid imagination, and I was a reclusive computer geek who avoided social interaction like a plague of leprosy and AIDS combined. Therefore, our interactions sometimes went as follows: Ebony: Here D, have a yummy cup of tea with me! Me: Eb, the only thing in this teacup is water... Eb: But, it's the tastiest water you'll ever have! Come on, drink with me and Mr. Ruffskin. [She had 50 stuffed animals, each with a different name.] Me: No, water always tastes like water, which doesn't actually have any taste, and if you try to give any to your bear, he'll just get all wet and soggy. Eb: Well then, how about some cake? Me: Eb, there's nothing on that plate. Eb: It's invisible cake. Me: Uh yeah, sure...I think I'll pass. Eb: Geez, you really suck, you party-pooper. Me: Shut up and let me get back to my computer game already. You know, that actually doesn't sound too much different from how I talk to her nowadays. I guess some things never change. Anyway, she's going off to Faith Master's Commission (or as she calls it, "bible school on steroids") in 2 weeks, and I'm beginning to imagine that I might miss her too. For most of my life, I've always been able to count on the fact that, no matter where I've been and what I've done, I can look forward to coming home to someone that practically worships me, someone who gets every single joke that comes out of my mouth, someone who will randomly hug me and say "I love you" no matter what I've said or done to her in the last 3 hours. Now, that someone won't be here for 9 months. If I was the crying type of guy, I think I might be sniffling right now. But, I guess it's the least I can endure after abandoning her here for 5 straight years. Besides, she can the most annoying little brat on the face of the earth sometimes. Shit, what the hell am I talking about; I'm gonna have a fucking blast without her. Uhhuh, yeah, that's right...*sniffles* K, bedtime. Peace and out

It would have been a whole shitload cheaper, especially if I had kept living at home (which I probably woulda done), and plus I would have made many more friends right here in good ol' El Pisso. Nope, I'll just stick to my plan of settling down in southeastern Texas, i.e. the San Antonio-Houston-Austin area. I guess I just can't pull myself away from this loud, arrogant state of mine, so I might as well keep it as my permanent home. Well, I'm back from the Road Trip of Utter Doom and, wooooo, it was a doozy. <lj-cut text="This is one huge mofo of an update, so I hope you have time to read a novel or 2...">I knew it was going to be <strike>pretty fucked up</strike> <strike>completely and totally screwed</strike> veeerrrrrrryy different when we started off by taking a single wrong turn in New Mexico and ended up 100 miles off-path in Roswell. [Sidenote: despite all the UFO landings and shit, Roswell is really just an average NM town. Rather disappointing.] My parents have got to be the worst navigators/direction followers I've ever met in my entire life. I never realized how lucky I was to have Steve the Walking GPS System on my previous roadtrip, until now. I swear, while coming back from Detroit, I told them to take I-94 all the way back to Ann Arbor, went to sleep, and woke up with us lost, halfway to Flint. How the fuck do you mess up directions from Detroit to A2? All you have to do is stay on one fucking highway!!! Le sigh. So yeah, I had to basically guide us through every single mile on the way to Michigan and back, but I got to drive most of the way, so it worked out OK. Over the course of the trip, we visited (meaning, we at least stopped and saw a monument in] 10 different cities across America: Roswell, Oklahoma City, St. Louis, Chicago, Ann Arbor, Detroit, Windsor, Indianapolis, Memphis, and Little Rock. Some awards I want to give out real quick:

State with the worst roads: Michigan (you know you can't deny it)
State with the best roads: Texas (no, I'm not being biased, they really were the best)
City with the most hick-farmer accents: Memphis
City with the rudest people: toss-up between Chicago and Detroit
City with the friendliest folk: Texarkana (we briefly stopped there to eat, and was greeted kindly by every single person we passed by. Man, I love Texas.)
City that's easiest to feel claustrophobia in: Chicago
City with the shittiest downtown: Memphis
City with the most impressive downtown: Chicago by sheer size, Indianapolis by sheer quality

There's plenty more, but I'll just have to add them when I think of them. Anyway, it was all more fun than I originally expected; the family turned out to be rather nice to chat with, despite their continuous preaching of God's Word. It felt good to talk about my whole Michigan experience, from the cutthroat atmosphere to the bitterly cold weather to my horrid choice in women. Well, that last one isn't quite true; I told my sister on the way back that I could no longer say anything bad about my exes, because despite the heartache, drama, and torment that both of them put me through, they were truly good girls deep down inside, and we just happened to mesh really badly. At least, that was the case with Kel and I; I'm still not quite sure what happened with Priya, and it looks like I'll never find out. Sometimes, I sorely miss that girl that I worshipped like a goddess for an entire year, but I've come to realize that that was probably more puppy-love than any true connection. As for Kel...well, that was one very complicated mess of a relationship. We had a lot goin for us, but there was so much more that was similar to butting my head against a brick wall. However, I must be honest and say that my own bull-headed stubbornness and lack of maturity was about 70% of the reason why we broke off like we did. Does that mean I'd want a 2nd chance with her? HELLS NO; if I had been thinking clearly way back when, I wouldn't have gotten together with her in the first place. I would elaborate, but I just said that I wouldn't say anything bad about her anymore. What I CAN say is that she was definitely the more mature of the 2 exes, and I certainly learned a lot from dating her. I just hope that she's doing well with Adam or whoever, cuz despite the many times I've described her as a shitty person, I know that she truly deserves better than what I gave her.

So yeah, I got a lot out of Michigan. I've developed the ability to adapt to any environment I'm ever in; I've encountered totally different cultures, thus deeply broadening my view of the world; I've gone through two fucked-up relationships and learned from them. I now know what it's like to struggle, to be utterly penniless, to starve, to be discriminated against, and to feel complete shame over who I am and how I act. Michigan took everything that I feared and despised on this earth, and threw it at me with full force; yet I dealt with it all and came out victorious, and will be able to do so again (with much more ease and rapidity) in the future. The roadtrip kinda helped in realizing all this, and thus I'm no longer upset about having to bring my parents along. Although, I'm sure I woulda had WAAAAAAYYYYY more fun without them, but hey, shit happens. Flush the toilet and keep moving. Peace.
